intro: Saurauia pedunculata var. fluviatilis, commonly known as the river saurauia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments near streams or rivers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
